intro: Oenothera punctata, commonly known as the dotted evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that open in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant has slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in prairie and disturbed habitats. Oenothera punctata is part of the Onagraceae family and is known for its ecological importance in supporting pollinator populations.
